commands.name: az network nsg create
commands.syntax:
az network nsg create --name
                      --resource-group
                      [--location]
                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                      [--tags]
examples: az network nsg create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyNsg --tags foo=bar

commands.name: az network nsg delete
commands.syntax:
az network nsg delete [--ids]
                      [--name]
                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                      [--resource-group]
                      [--subscription]
examples: az network nsg delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyNsg

commands.name: az network nsg show
commands.summary: Get information about a network security group.
examples: az network nsg show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyNsg
az network nsg show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyNsg --query "defaultSecurityRules[]" -o table
az network nsg show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyNsg --query "defaultSecurityRules[?access=='Allow']" -o table

commands.name: az network nsg update
commands.syntax:
az network nsg update [--add]
                      [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                      [--ids]
                      [--location]
                      [--name]
                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                      [--remove]
                      [--resource-group]
                      [--set]
                      [--subscription]
                      [--tags]
examples: az network nsg update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyNsg --remove tags.no_80
az network nsg update --name MyNsg --resource-group MyResourceGroup --set tags.CostCenter=MyBusinessGroup

commands.name: az network nsg wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
